alert.note: Alert for Breathitt (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 29 at 2:32AM EDT until July 31 at 6:50AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Kentucky... The North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson, affecting Breathitt County. ...A FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Major flooding is occurring and major flooding is forecast. A new flood of record will be established. * WHERE...The Flood Warning is for the North Fork of the Kentucky River at Jackson. * WHEN...The Flood Warning is in effect until Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 43.1 feet, flooding exceeded the highest flood on record. Large sections of the town are inundated. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2 AM EDT Friday the stage was 43.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is nearing a crest which is expected to be around 43.5 feet. The river will begin to fall overnight, and should fall below flood stage Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - The previous flood of record was 43.1 feet on 02/04/1939. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. The next statement will be issued by 5 AM.
